Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town's Crossroads: Personal and Public Conflicts
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting of Ghost Town and its inhabitants, establishing initial conflicts on both personal and community levels. It begins with a romantic dispute and quickly expands to encompass the threat of modernization and the reactions of the town's residents to impending change.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Discord and Departure in Ghost Town
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets the stage in Ghost Town, introducing Nan (Woman in green hat) and Cal (Cowboy) and their initial romantic conflict, leading to Cal's frustrated departure. It also introduces the setting and atmosphere of Ghost Town.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to the Girl from Ghost Town and Initial Conflict

sub_scenes.title: The Airport Plan and Community Uproar
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the surveyors and the disruptive plan to build an airport in Ghost Town, revealing a town-level conflict that shocks the community and especially affects Cal, who overhears the news.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival of Surveyors and the Airport Plan
Cowboy's Shock and the Impending Destruction of Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Misunderstandings and Nan's Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene continues the personal conflict between Nan and Cal, focusing on their romantic misunderstandings and Nan's internal reflections as she departs from Ghost Town.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Romantic Misunderstanding and Parting
Nan's Reflection on Love and Past Hurt

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Rough Element and Town's Discontent
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a new element of rough men and expresses the town's resentment towards 'progress', hinting at broader community tensions and potential dangers within Ghost Town.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival of Rough Men and Discontent with 'Progress'

sub_scenes.title: Businessmen's Dismissal and Nan's Humiliation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to an indoor setting where businessmen discuss the airport, and Nan's attempt to participate is met with dismissal and humiliation, leading to familial conflict and emotional distress.

narrative_arcs.title: Businessmen Discuss Airport and Horses, Nan Interjects

sub_scenes.title: Consolation and Nan's Resolve
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Nan being comforted by her mother and maid, which leads to Nan gaining resolve and deciding to confront Cal, shifting her from passivity to action.

narrative_arcs.title: Mother and Maid Console Nan About Cal

sub_scenes.title: Business Deal and Unwavering Commitment
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene briefly shifts focus to a business dealing involving horses and a firm, unchangeable agreement, adding another layer to Nan's life beyond her romantic issues.

sub_scenes.title: Failed Reconciliation and Growing Loneliness
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Nan and Cal's unsuccessful attempt at reconciliation and Cal's continued departure, leading to Nan's experience of growing loneliness over time.

sub_scenes.title: Unexpected Return and Hesitant Confession
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene provides a twist with Cal's unexpected return and his confession of following Nan, revealing his hidden feelings and internal conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Conversation and Approaching Winter Crisis
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene continues Nan and Cal's emotional conversation but is interrupted by the arrival of severe winter weather, shifting the narrative towards a community-level crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Community Worry and Domestic Comfort Amidst Snowstorm
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the community's growing anxiety about the snowstorm and its impact on livestock, contrasted with a brief moment of domestic comfort indoors, highlighting the tension between external crisis and internal solace.

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Crisis and Cal's Decisive Action
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene escalates the weather crisis, emphasizing the relentless snowfall and leading to Cal's decision to take action and rally help to save the livestock, shifting from worry to proactive response.

sub_scenes.title: Despair and Fragile Hope in the Snowstorm
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the community's despair amidst the relentless snowfall, contrasted with a fragile attempt at reassurance, showcasing the emotional toll of the crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Salvation from the Sky and Romantic Reflection
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene marks a turning point with the arrival of a plane dropping fodder, bringing relief and hope to the community, followed by a reflective conversation between Nan and Cal, shifting focus to their relationship in light of the day's events.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: Arrival of the Plane and Fodder

Major_Arcs.title: The Arrival of Chane Benson and Town Dynamics
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and his dramatic entrance into a new town, exploring the various reactions of the townspeople to his forceful personality and actions. It delves into themes of heroism, gossip, and underlying tensions within the community.

sub_scenes.title: Chane Benson's Dramatic Entrance and Town Reaction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Chane Benson through a public showdown, immediately establishing his forceful character and eliciting varied reactions from the town's inhabitants.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Hero Worship and Family Concerns
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts focus to Jeff and his problematic hero worship of his father, and his sister's concern about Jeff's potentially unhealthy admiration and behavior.

narrative_arcs.title: Reminiscing About Jeff's Childhood Hero Worship
Justifying Actions with Clyde Surrett's Example
Dismissing Chane Benson and Embracing Violence

sub_scenes.title: Sister's Despair and Plea for Help
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the sister's despair over Jeff's path and her desperate plea to Clyde for help in guiding Jeff away from violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Expressing Fear and Seeking Help from Clyde
Declaration of Love and Duty Towards Jeff
Reassurance and Promise of Shared Happiness

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Disappearance and Town Intrigue
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene marks Jeff's disappearance, prompting the sister's pursuit and introduces Mr. Benson into the narrative as a source of 'tips' and information, adding layers of intrigue.

narrative_arcs.title: Jeff's Disappearance and Pursuit to Town
Introduction of Mr. Benson and Seeking Advice
Chane Benson's Menacing Demeanor and Disdain for Young Boys

sub_scenes.title: Article's Repercussions and Benson's Threats
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals the consequences of an article published about Chane Benson, leading to Benson's threats and escalating the tension between Benson and the town.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation about the Article and Benson's Threat
Warning about Benson's Cunning and Cowardice
Seeking Action from the Editor and Decision to Stay

sub_scenes.title: Editor's Resolve and Contemplation of Strategy
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the Editor's unwavering resolve and his internal consideration of different strategies to deal with Chane Benson, ranging from reason to force.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Unwavering Resolve and Benson's Character

sub_scenes.title: Shifting Opinions and Ill-Fated Dinner Invitation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts shifting opinions about Benson, particularly Jeff's, influenced by Sally, leading to a dinner invitation, setting up a potentially dangerous and manipulative social interaction.

narrative_arcs.title: Shifting Opinions and Dinner Invitation Idea

sub_scenes.title: Moonlight Charm and Explosive Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with a seemingly calm aftermath of the dinner but quickly escalates into a confrontation between Jeff, Sally, and Chane Benson, revealing underlying tensions and manipulations.

sub_scenes.title: Fight, Warning, and Race to Rescue Clyde
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the physical fight between Jeff and Chane, Sally's warning about Clyde's danger, and Jeff's determined race to rescue Clyde from Benson's men.

narrative_arcs.title: Fight, Warning, and Race to Rescue Clyde

sub_scenes.title: Showdown and Clarion Office Flashback
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the immediate showdown with Clyde captured, contrasted with a flashback to the tense atmosphere of the Clarion office, adding depth and context.

sub_scenes.title: Censorship, Planning, and Journalistic Resolve
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Sally and Jeff discussing censorship, followed by Clyde, Jeff, and another man planning the next edition of the Clarion, emphasizing their commitment to journalism despite adversity.

Major_Arcs.title: The Ranch and Steve Daley's Arrival
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new setting at a ranch and the character Steve Daley. It explores ranch conflicts, initial distrust, and the unfolding relationship between Betsy and Steve, leading to romance amidst ranch troubles.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Confrontation and Steve Daley's Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene opens with a ranch confrontation and then smoothly transitions to introduce Steve Daley and his hiring by Hank at Betsy's ranch.

sub_scenes.title: Bunk Assignment and Hank's Unease
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Betsy assigning Steve his bunk and then shifts to a conversation between Hank and Betsy where Hank expresses his unease about hiring Steve, contrasted with Betsy's past acquaintance with him.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Troubles and Buckboard Journey
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals the problems plaguing the ranch and Betsy's cautious approach, followed by a buckboard ride where Betsy reflects on her past with Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Hank's Orders and Town Arrival
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene briefly shows Hank giving orders and then transitions to Betsy and Steve arriving in town, where Betsy questions Hank's control and tests Steve's loyalty.

sub_scenes.title: Town Gossip and Betsy's Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts town gossip about Betsy and her assertive confrontation with some men, leading to physical retaliation on her behalf.

sub_scenes.title: Bodyguard Confirmation and Hank's Plea to Stay
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene confirms Steve's role as Betsy's bodyguard and introduces Hank's desperate plea to keep his job, revealing his attachment to the ranch and Betsy.

narrative_arcs.title: Hank's Job Secured and Gratitude Expressed

sub_scenes.title: Gun Condition, Choice, and Betsy's Change of Heart
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Betsy setting a condition for Steve's job (no guns), giving him a choice, and then suddenly changing her mind, revealing her true feelings for him.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarification and Choice about Gunfighter Role
Betsy's Change of Heart and Plea to Stay

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Confession and Bridges' Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the romantic climax between Betsy and Steve, with mutual confessions of love, immediately followed by the arrival of Old Man Bridges and a tense confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Declaration of War and Betsy's Authority
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene interprets Bridges' actions as a declaration of war and shows Betsy asserting her authority and right to bear arms in the face of the threat.

narrative_arcs.title: Analysis of the Confrontation as a Declaration of War
Betsy's Assertion of Authority and Gun Ownership

sub_scenes.title: Flashback to Tragedy and Steve's Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene provides a flashback to Hank's ambush and death, motivating the current conflict, followed by Steve's determined decision to leave and confront the situation, despite Betsy's pleas.

narrative_arcs.title: Steve's Reflection, Flashback to Ambush, and Hank's Fate

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Pursuit and Devil's Pass Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Betsy's reflection and decision to follow Steve to Devil's Pass, leading to a violent confrontation and Betsy getting shot.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Confrontation

sub_scenes.title: Aftermath, Survival, and Romantic Reaffirmation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Betsy's survival, her reunion with Steve, and their romantic reaffirmation amidst the aftermath of the violent confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Survival and Reunion with Steve

Major_Arcs.title: Dave, Carrie, and Shifting Romantic Dynamics
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to Carrie, Dave, and Fred, exploring complex romantic relationships and shifting dynamics. It involves arguments, reconsiderations, and ultimately a change in romantic pairings.

sub_scenes.title: Argument Over Dave and Curley's Actions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene opens with an argument about Dave and then shifts to observations of Curley's unexpected actions, setting up new points of interest.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Trouble and Territorial Dispute
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a new conflict involving a territorial dispute with buyers of the Bar Fenin ranch, adding a ranch-level conflict to the narrative.

narrative_arcs.title: Trouble with Bar Fenin Ranch Buyers

sub_scenes.title: Fence Dispute and Fred Gordon's Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene elaborates on the territorial dispute, focusing on the fence issue and leading to a direct and angry confrontation by Fred Gordon.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussing the Fence and Range Issues
Fred Gordon's Confrontation at the Fence

sub_scenes.title: Gunfight and Forceful Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the escalation of the fence dispute into a gunfight and its forceful resolution, establishing clear boundaries.

sub_scenes.title: Apology, Reconciliation, and Lingering Regret
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Carrie's apology to Dave and their reconciliation, contrasted with a tense interaction with Fred and a lingering sense of regret from Dave.

narrative_arcs.title: Intimate Conversation and Reflection on Fred

sub_scenes.title: Fred Gordon's Ominous Return and Carrie's Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reintroduces Fred Gordon in an ominous way, leading to Carrie's direct and suspicious confrontation, disrupting the peaceful moment.

sub_scenes.title: Private Confession and Shifting Romantic Focus
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene features a private conversation where Carrie explains Fred's motivations and hints at a plan, shifting the romantic focus and setting up a new direction for their relationship.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Resolution and Rejection of Fred
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene provides romantic closure for Carrie and Dave, culminating in a marriage proposal while implicitly rejecting Fred and his ambitions.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflection on Past Misunderstandings and Romantic Resolution

sub_scenes.title: Carlton Contract and Betrayal Accusation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the Carlton contract as a crucial plot point and shows Carrie's angry confrontation with Dave, accusing him of betrayal and trickery related to the contract.

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Determined Action and Confrontation with Fred
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Carrie's resolve to fight back against Fred's manipulation and her planned confrontation with Mr. Carlton, with Dave and Fred present, setting up a tense encounter.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Inquiry with Dave and Fred

sub_scenes.title: Resolution at Carlton's Office and Father's Comfort
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Carrie's arrival at Carlton's office, the resolution orchestrated by her father, and her emotional release and comfort from her father after the tense situation.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Interruption at Carlton's Office
Carlton's Business History and Carrie's Resolution

sub_scenes.title: Independence Declaration and Bar Gossip
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Carrie declaring her independence from the West and her encounter with Dave, where she hears bar gossip about Fred's potential downfall.

narrative_arcs.title: Declaration of Independence and Western Identity

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Turmoil and Confession of Love for Fred
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene delves into Carrie's emotional turmoil, leading to her surprising confession of love for Fred, despite her previous engagement to Dave.

narrative_arcs.title: Anger, Apology, and Question of Love

sub_scenes.title: Father's Wisdom and Dave's Accusation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene contrasts fatherly wisdom and reflection with Dave's accusatory and skeptical reaction to Carrie's confession and departure, highlighting the diverging viewpoints.

narrative_arcs.title: Father's Wisdom and Long Ride Home
Accusation of Heartbreak and Eastern Trickery

sub_scenes.title: Internal Misery and News of Fred's Survival
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Carrie's internal misery and then shifts to the arrival of news confirming Fred's survival, correcting her misunderstanding and setting up a reunion.

sub_scenes.title: Revelation of Sacrifice and Romantic Reunion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals Fred's sacrifice and true feelings, leading to an emotional reunion and romantic reconciliation between Carrie and Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflection on Dave's Words and Embracing Love

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance's Final Showdown
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on the conflict between Dirk and Rance, culminating in a chase, a shooting, and a moral dilemma. It explores themes of duty, brotherhood, and love amidst violence.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Desperate Plea and True Injury Revealed
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene starts with Dirk's urgent plea for help and then reveals the severity of his injury, contradicting his initial downplaying of it.

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Mistaken Identity
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts an investigation into the shooting, starting with an older man's concern and then shifting to Chris Ransom's arrival at a ranch and mistaken identity.

narrative_arcs.title: Forced Search and Blood Stained Pinto

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation, Duty, and Moral Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows a confrontation about Dirk's actions, the assertion of duty by law enforcement, and a moral conflict regarding leaving Dirk unguarded.

sub_scenes.title: Reflective Reunion and Resignation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to a reflective moment where Dirk contemplates escape, followed by an unexpected reunion with a woman and a tone of resignation.

sub_scenes.title: Confession, Mutual Love, and Duty's Call
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene features Chris's passionate confession of love for Rance, their mutual declaration, and the immediate return to duty as Rance must pursue Dirk.

sub_scenes.title: The Chase, Confrontation, and Shooting
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the relentless chase, the face-to-face confrontation between Rance and Dirk, and the violent climax with Rance shooting.

sub_scenes.title: Aftermath, Moral Dilemma, and Difficult Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the immediate aftermath of the shooting, a moral dilemma about the wounded person's fate, and the difficult decision for Dirk and Chris to depart, leaving Rance behind.

narrative_arcs.title: The Difficult Departure and Lingering Feelings

sub_scenes.title: Confession of Love and Dirk's Escape
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene highlights Chris's confession of love for Rance and her decision to return to him, contrasted with Dirk's escape to Mexico and Rance's mixed emotions.

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Recovery and Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Rance's recovery, Chris's devoted care, their mutual confessions of love, and ultimately Rance's marriage proposal, providing a romantic resolution after the conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Mutual Feelings and Confession of Love

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Day and Dirk's Unexpected Appearance
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to the wedding day, showing preparations and then Dirk's dramatic and unexpected arrival, creating a final moment of suspense.

narrative_arcs.title: Chris's Concern and Rance's Reassurance about Dirk

sub_scenes.title: Marshal's Trap and Brother's Backstory
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals the Marshal's planned trap for Dirk and provides backstory about Dirk's past actions and legal outcomes, offering final closure and context to Dirk's narrative.

narrative_arcs.title: The Marshal's Appreciation and Wedding Gift
